summary: This is an email chain from July 2008 between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation. It discusses a potential victim who recalls events and is scheduled to meet with the FBI, and includes a forwarded message from attorney Ted Leopold providing client names.

persons.name: M. Ma
persons.context: FBI agent sending an email on July 4, 2008, discussing a potential victim's upcoming FBI meeting and forwarding information about the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ted Leopold
persons.context: Attorney who sent an email on July 3, 2008, providing the names of two clients in relation to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: Attorney copied on Ted Leopold's July 3, 2008 email regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in the Epstein investigation; Kuvin was copied on Leopold's email.
FBI agent Ma is part of an email chain that includes information forwarded from attorney Ted Leopold regarding the investigation.

events.title: Victim scheduled to meet FBI
events.description: A potential victim, who recalls events and felt ashamed and uncomfortable, is scheduled to come to the FBI at 9:30 AM on Monday.

events.title: Attorney provides client names
events.description: Attorney Ted Leopold sends an email providing the names of two clients in relation to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: A potential victim in the Epstein case recalls events, felt ashamed and uncomfortable, and was scheduled to meet with the FBI on Monday, July 7, 2008, at 9:30 AM.
Attorney Ted Leopold provided the names of two clients to the U.S. Attorney's office in connection with the Epstein investigation on July 3, 2008.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's office in West Palm Beach regarding the investigation in July 2008.
The document references an individual named 'M.' whose identity was being checked by investigators, indicating active witness/victim identification efforts.
